text: The Party of Democratic Activity ( or A-SDA) is a conservative political party in Bosnia and Herzegovina. ==History== The party was established in February 2008 as a breakaway from the Party of Democratic Action.Elections in Bosnia and Herzegovina FRIDA Based in Cazin, its founders included town mayor Nermin Ogrešević. In the 2010 general elections, A-SDA ran only in the Federation of Bosnia and Herzegovina part of Bosnia. It received 1.7% of the vote, failing to win a seat in the national House of Representatives,Parliamentary Assembly, Federation of Bosnia and Herzegovina Central Elections Commission However, it won one seat in the House of Representatives of the Federation of Bosnia and Herzegovina with 1.9% of the vote.Parliament of FBiH Central Elections Commission In the 2014 elections the party increased its vote share to 2.25%, winning a seat in the national House of Representatives.Parliamentary Assembly, Federation of Bosnia and Herzegovina Central Elections Commission It also won two seats in the Federation House.Parliament of FBiH Central Elections Commission Its member of the country's legislature is Jasmin Emrić, who holds a seat in the Federation of Bosnia and Herzegovina's first division. ==References== ==External links== *Official website Category:Political parties in Bosnia and Herzegovina Category:Bosniak political parties in Bosnia and Herzegovina Category:Conservative parties in Bosnia and Herzegovina Category:Pro-European political parties in Bosnia and Herzegovina Category:Political parties established in 2008 Category:2008 establishments in Bosnia and Herzegovina
title: Party of Democratic Activity
